title: Death knight
data:
***Version [0.31](/0.31 "0.31")**: This article **may not be** up to date for the [latest stable release](/0.32 "0.32") of Crawl.*

*This page is about the monster. For the obsolete background see [Death Knight (background)](/Death_Knight_\(background\) "Death Knight (background)").*

| death knight p [![Death knight.png](/images/d/da/Death_knight.png)](/File:Death_knight.png) |                                                                                                                                                                                |
| ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ |

|   |                                                                                                      |
| - | ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
|   | A warrior-priest of Yredelemnul that chants unholy homages to the dark god and calls forth the dead. |

## Contents

- [1 Useful Info](#Useful_Info)
- [2 Spells](#Spells)
- [3 Tips & Tricks](#Tips_.26_Tricks)
- [4 History](#History)

## Useful Info

**Death knights** are human followers of [Yredelemnul](/Yredelemnul "Yredelemnul"). They can cast [Agony](/Agony "Agony") and reflect damage back to they take. They spawn in late [Dungeon](/Dungeon "Dungeon"), as well as [the Crypt](/The_Crypt "The Crypt") - usually with undead like [freezing wraiths](/Freezing_wraith "Freezing wraith"), [phantasmal warriors](/Phantasmal_warrior "Phantasmal warrior"), and [flayed ghosts](/Flayed_ghost "Flayed ghost").

As followers of Yredelemnul, death knights are unaffected by [umbra](/Umbra "Umbra")'s accuracy penalty. As humans, they are not vulnerable to [holy wrath](/Holy_wrath "Holy wrath").

## Spells

| Spell set I |                                                 |                                                     |
| :---------- | ----------------------------------------------- | --------------------------------------------------- |
| Slot1       | [Agony](/Agony "Agony")                         | [Priest flag](/Spell_slot_flags "Spell slot flags") |
| Slot2       | [Injury Mirror](/Injury_Mirror "Injury Mirror") | [Priest flag](/Spell_slot_flags "Spell slot flags") |

## Tips & Tricks

- Agony is basically [torment](/Torment "Torment"), so it hurts a lot. A [potion of lignification](/Potion_of_lignification "Potion of lignification") gives immunity to this spell. Having high [willpower](/Willpower "Willpower") reduces the chance of it affecting you.
- Watch out for Injury Mirror - it's often a good idea to stop attacking the knight during Injury Mirror. Check for the status icon (or the status text in console) to make sure it ends. Also note that lasting effects, e.g. [poison](/Poison "Poison") and [clouds](/Cloud "Cloud"), count as your damage for their duration.

## History

- Prior to [0.18](/0.18 "0.18"), death knights could cast [Haunt](/Haunt "Haunt"), and could not be found in the Dungeon.
- Prior to [0.17](/0.17 "0.17"), death knights could cast [Drain Life](/Drain_Life "Drain Life") and [Animate Dead](/Animate_Dead "Animate Dead") instead of Agony and Haunt.
- Death knights replaced [deep dwarf death knights](/Deep_dwarf_death_knight "Deep dwarf death knight") in [0.15](/0.15 "0.15").
html:
Death knight

From CrawlWiki
Jump to: navigation, search
Version 0.31: This article may not be up to date for the latest stable release of Crawl.

This page is about the monster. For the obsolete background see Death Knight (background).

death knight p 
HP 52-107
HD 10
XP 912
Speed 10
AC 10
EV 9
Will 80
Attack1 28 (hit: plain)


Resistances None
Vulnerabilities Holy
Habitat Land
Intelligence Human
Uses Weapons & armour
Starting equipment
Open doors
Holiness Natural
Size Medium
Type human, human
Flags Fighter
Evil
Speaks
Warm-blooded
A warrior-priest of Yredelemnul that chants unholy homages to the dark god and calls forth the dead.

Contents

  • 1 Useful Info
  • 2 Spells
  • 3 Tips & Tricks
  • 4 History

Useful Info

Death knights are human followers of Yredelemnul. They can cast Agony and reflect damage back to they take. They spawn in late Dungeon, as well as the Crypt - usually with undead like freezing wraiths, phantasmal warriors, and flayed ghosts.

As followers of Yredelemnul, death knights are unaffected by umbra's accuracy penalty. As humans, they are not vulnerable to holy wrath.

Spells

Spell set I
Slot1 Agony Priest flag
Slot2 Injury Mirror Priest flag

Tips & Tricks

  • Agony is basically torment, so it hurts a lot. A potion of lignification gives immunity to this spell. Having high willpower reduces the chance of it affecting you.
  • Watch out for Injury Mirror - it's often a good idea to stop attacking the knight during Injury Mirror. Check for the status icon (or the status text in console) to make sure it ends. Also note that lasting effects, e.g. poison and clouds, count as your damage for their duration.

History

  • Prior to 0.18, death knights could cast Haunt, and could not be found in the Dungeon.
  • Prior to 0.17, death knights could cast Drain Life and Animate Dead instead of Agony and Haunt.
  • Death knights replaced deep dwarf death knights in 0.15.

rawPage:
{{version031}}
''This page is about the monster. For the obsolete background see [[Death Knight (background)]].''
{{monster info|death knight}}

==Useful Info==
'''Death knights''' are human followers of [[Yredelemnul]]. They can cast [[Agony]] and reflect damage back to they take. They spawn in late [[Dungeon]], as well as [[the Crypt]] - usually with undead like [[freezing wraith]]s, [[phantasmal warrior]]s, and [[flayed ghost]]s.

As followers of Yredelemnul, death knights are unaffected by [[umbra]]'s accuracy penalty. As humans, they are not vulnerable to [[holy wrath]].

{{monster spells|Death knight}}

==Tips & Tricks==
*Agony is basically [[torment]], so it hurts a lot. A [[potion of lignification]] gives immunity to this spell. Having high [[willpower]] reduces the chance of it affecting you.
*Watch out for Injury Mirror - it's often a good idea to stop attacking the knight during Injury Mirror. Check for the status icon (or the status text in console) to make sure it ends. Also note that lasting effects, e.g. [[poison]] and [[cloud]]s, count as your damage for their duration.

==History==
*Prior to [[0.18]], death knights could cast [[Haunt]], and could not be found in the Dungeon.
*Prior to [[0.17]], death knights could cast [[Drain Life]] and [[Animate Dead]] instead of Agony and Haunt.
*Death knights replaced [[deep dwarf death knight]]s in [[0.15]].

[[Category:Human]]
